lq7k8B9a4Qv_RBBVw13Bxw.text: I LOVE WAGAMAMA! i actually tend to hate asian food but wagamamas is brilliant. I can eat pretty much anything and the restaurants are always really tidy and nice and friendly, and in general its a great restaurant. Friendly staff and delicious food. Nothing to criticise

LOHhfK4ncqilnjHkm3FJ8A.text: msg sucks. food is alright, service works generally. pretty fancy macdonalds with a bit of ikea if you ask me. at least its sort of cheap

XJTzJI_rDJk_lGALOZ6_jw.text: Reminded me of a fancy cafeteria. Our waiter was a nice young man. However, the food lacked a lot of flavor. I thought this place would have delicious food, but I ended up forcing myself to eat it because I was hungry. Nothing special.

GfWWYGDE0B46xocQmYkmdg.text: Came here with my British colleagues who adore Wagamama. It was pretty good, but not my favorite. They really pack it with people, and there is basically no ambiance. I can tell their focus is more the food, so I was looking forward to that. There are surprisingly few veggie options for an asian noodle place. I got the yasai katsu curry, because it sounded different and interesting; it was decent but actually didn't have as much flavor as I expected. I'll probably go back and try a noodle dish to see if there are better results, but I don't have high expectations at this point.

ygmCi4TtDfhmh3Q7V4nyVA.text: The waiter (seemed to be the manager) was not polite. Several times food was brought to our table that we had not ordered. It seemed to me rather like a fast food place. This is not a Japanese restaurant. I was deeply disappointed by the service and the quality of the food.

3EKldjgufRGJFns2mbQ1TA.text: Absolutly not recommend! The food was soso, for one who realy love noodle soup during traveling period, this restaurant provide nothing special. Just like other poorly managed franchise, everything kept in a very low standard. The soup was warm (not hot) when brought to table, this makes it lost flavour and taste bad, the noodle taste just like instant noodles, and most of all, the service was horrible! We got totally ignored for the whole meal time, and the restaurant was only half seated! The waitress seemed trying to avoid to come to our table, though it was our first time there. We chose this restaurant because I checked the review on Yelp and it got 4 stars from over 30 reviews. I had to say that London people are realy nice and had low requirement of their restaurant.  Never come again, will look for other options if want noodles.

Ydpxd9Ipt0XtgUcHiLnB8Q.text: The food is tasty and mouth-watering. This place is welcoming, but it is not good for first dates for example. The sushi is made on a professional way, I can not hide that I simply love the delicious sushi rolls and soy sauce. I appreciate the politeness of the staff. You'll enjoy your meal and I'm sure of this.

2VQk8LpReRteRiuDZWi8Hg.text: Prices are reasonable.  Service is attentive and friendly.  Food is generally very good but not great... Several dishes were surprisingly not as flavorful as we'd get set similar restaurants back in the States.

WTUBF2JAW-8toOPjy2Gr2A.text: Ok, I love Asian food, so the fact that I was in London wasn't going to stop me from eating something other than "traditional English" food!! This was walking distance from our hotel, quick and inexpensive!! For $10 I had a great meal! Pretty large selection, fresh and nice presentation!! ZERO decor!!I would compare this to a "pick up stix" in the U.S.

GCDb_NYXILHd_X3A1eA_wg.text: We ate at Wagamama at Cardinal Place, Victoria, London on Thursday, July 18th, 2013. We were with a group and our menu selection was pre-selected for us. We had a Teppanyaki selection and it was very tasty! The staffers were friendly and kept the water refills coming on the hot day we were there. I can recommend this place to anyone who wants a tasty Asian-infused meal in a clean environment with good staffers.

DOBd9XOtCkZA9IPrUq7Qjw.text: One of the larger venues of this expanding chain, offering fast Japanese food (predominantly noodle dishes) in minimalist surroundings. Outdoor seating in summer. This is situated on the first floor 'roof level' of the new Cardinal Place shopping centre in Victoria - itself an architecturally dramatic addition to the area.

Aht_YaY8L-1yf0oAw4S7BA.text: Wagamama is an asian fusion place offering a decent selection of noodles.  Friends and coworkers ranted and raved about how good their ramen was and highly recommended that I try it since I would be near one on my last trip... so I went, expecting some really authentic Japanese ramen - only to discover it's more of a fusion chain, and not authentic (or close) at all!  It is a good lunch place, even if the picnic table style seating might throw you off a little.  I did end up going back several times because it was clean, reasonably priced, and quick - don't expect anything close to authentic yakisoba or ramen and you'll be fine.

hakKa8UH4UTgawtpK7Wihw.text: My favourite part of this Wagamama venue is that its above everything else, slightly separated from the hustle and bustle, calmer.Other than that; the food is fab, the staff are lovely and the service is usually quick.I'm still undecided (after going to 3 different branches) as to whether I like Wagamama food or not, but that's not because of the food quality (its brilliant) but just my personal tastes. I will certainly go back to this branch in particular, really nice place.

photos.caption: Photo of Wagamama - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Wagamama - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Wagamama - London, United Kingdom

Vsr6xWFbSAFYGe1EhIKreg.text: One of the best asians in the world! Every time I get there I am amazed after how so many years the quality and the system are still at its best. The food comes fast, fresh and almost every dish is tasting well. Very fashionable and pure fun to sit with a bunch of friends, I wouldn't recommend it for the first dates, though.

photos.caption: Photo of Wagamama - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Wagamama - London, United Kingdom

P0-jysH80XlEs1HiCl0a5w.text: I was a bit apprehensive when I came in to this Wagamama location, due to the sheer volume of people. I was blown away though by the speed of service and how great the food turned out. The food is fantastic and the atmosphere is great as well!

HKS-Kvzrsq6ysWrbVYXbgg.text: Friendly service, great noodles, delicious raw juice and a great place for a solo traveler to eat. This is probably the best place to grab a meal within walking distance of Victoria Station. I usually pull into London through Victoria Station, hungry from traveling, and I usually head straight for this place.

SqDOwGVoLfMMQUN-UDDj8Q.text: Probably 4.5 stars, if I could give it.Ok, yes, I'm reviewing a chain restaurant! That said, Wagamama's is usually a reliable bet for Asian fusion food, and last night proved no exception as I and a friend ate here before going to the theatre. The quality of the food was good, and service was correct and rapid, if slightly impatient during the ordering process at times. Pricing is (as every) reasonable -- perhaps slightly expensive compared to the individual Asian canteens, but the food quality makes up for it.This particular Wagamama's is very well-placed in the Cardinal Place complex, merely 5 minutes walk away from Victoria station, and very close to both the Apollo Victoria and the Victoria Palace theatres. Its location is also picturesque, on the quieter upper tier next to the SW1 Gallery and on the partially glass-covered courtyard. A restful place to eat before the theatre, with no need to worry about slow service!

-y0NP9a2zYF1rVjP1V0NDA.text: I know Wagamama is a chain, but sometimes these chains differ from restaurant to restaurant.  Having said that I've been to a few Wagas and they are all generally good, with friendly service and you can pretty much guarantee the food is always the same.I have a few favourites on the menu:Chicken ItameChicken Tama Rice Chicken RamenDuck Gyoza and Tori Kara Age are both very good as sides.Today I had Chicken Chili Men, which was very good too - just the right amount of chili, I'll be adding it to my list of favourites.Wagamamas is a good alternative (although quite a bit more expensive) to a fast food place, as its generally a quick turn around and you do sometimes have the food come out at different times - so dont wait for everyone to get there food before you dig in!As the seating is all benches, you can sometimes have trouble getting a table for a large group, although today we managed to get seating for 9 with only a 15 minute wait.  Good friendly service today too.

ZO_aE0q_did055uF0tpOhQ.text: I really like Wagamama. A friend used to say to me years ago 'what you haven't been to Wagamama' and I managed to answer 'no I haven't' for many years. But eventually I gave in and had some food at Streatham Street, WC1B and had some great food. Consistent like a good chain should be but each restaurant has it's own character and it's own attitude. Cardinal place is basically on my way home and on a Friday evening on the way home I enjoy nothing more than a Ebi Kare Lomen, a raw juice (now large) and then let the lovely staff do the washing up leaving me free to go home and relax with a nice cup of herbal tea. They have been going for years, gone global and I still return even after a break away from them. Good food, good value and positive staff.

WuJbA-t8hnt4P7ACGal6gQ.text: Ate here tonight with my husband and our 4 children, and was pleasantly surprised. It is extremely hard to find restaurants in London that are child friendly and cheap-ish, but still good.  Great prices, and the kids really enjoyed their food (simple chicken and veggies, with fun kids chopsticks). Our grownup food was pretty yum too.  This place will be a new staple for us.

hxCFIS4a9qreErM4GaRRoA.text: Love Wagamama so much - I went and bought the cookbook!Cheap, cheerful and usually comes extremely quickly - which I'm not worried about because stir frys only take a couple of minutes! Food is always tasty, always rich in flavours and yeah, great place to eat. Lovely atmosphere in there as well!

KINrC2EQlS2CFXEdtjCWzw.text: I am a long time Wagamama addict. Recently however, I was massively disappointed at this specific location when my food arrived very late and nearly cold. I complained mildly and within a couple of minutes the manager arrived and gave me the starter for free. Great way to turn my verdict around. Five stars then.

_Tzdv1UmxSbQqeYDvzCmUw.text: I went to two Wagamama's for lunch during the two days I was in London. I don't regret it. But admittedly, I still felt underwhelmed by the food. This time, I had a raw salad and the signature Wagamama Ramen. The salad was fine--I was just happy to have some greens instead of the heavy pies, sausages & gravies I had been eating the prior week in Northern England. The ramen itself was filled with lots of delicious things - pork, shrimp, chicken, mussels, a tea egg, chikuwa and wakame. I didn't find the broth to be very flavorful - in fact, I had to add soy sauce to add salt as it just tasted bland without it. And well, this is not their fault, but this just reconfirmed that I really don't like mussels. If you do like mussels, then you will be happy with the amount they add to the bowl, but if you don't, it might just be best to ask them to not add them at all.Other than that, everything else was pretty enjoyable and despite being super crowded, my service was very attentive from start to finish.

photos.caption: Photo of Wagamama - London, United Kingdom. Wagamama ramen

yt9mvAlXKhzesanx51qeyg.text: Excellent service! Food allergy aware and able to tailor food accordingly, just ask the manager! Kids friendly ..... staff interaction with our kids were excellent. Overall an excellent experience. Would come here again!

vchQ_6OaMuX0v-HKIIzSsg.text: I had beef donburi and it wasn't very good. The service was really slow, but the wait staff was nice when they were able to stop by. It's also too expensive for what it was. Not a horrible experience but I wouldn't go back.

gSa5wTqXjquoGETcNUiczw.text: If you just love asianfood like I do, then I will recommend this place! Lovely food, and beauty food for pictures ;-) Spicy, tasty and delicious!

photos.caption: Photo of Wagamama - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Wagamama - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Wagamama - London, United Kingdom

UpAuWglVOE5_zrQWEK33sA.text: We always come to Wagamma whenever we come to London (specifically this location since it is near our hotel). It's something we don't have back in the states and I always crave it. Our service is always great. We are seated right away when we arrive even though it was crowded with people who work in the surrounding area. I had the ramen and it had an assortment of seafood such as mussels, squid, shrimp. It was very filling and very tasty. It was just the right amount of saltiness for me and the flavors were very good. I also had the raw juice there. It was very good and didn't need any added sugar. Our server was very attentive despite it being crowded. I would continue to go back to Wagamma every time I come to London.

f-KOC52Wx4m7koxixlvPsw.text: Great place. Went here on vacation while trying to find some Asian food, definitely a little westernized but overall delicious. Loved the noodles and the sauce (like chow mein or yakisoba), the braised beef ramen was to die for, the buns were equally great. The portions of the entrees are large but no sharing required if you are hungry.

photos.caption: Photo of Wagamama - London, United Kingdom. Buns, good meat but too much sauce.
Photo of Wagamama - London, United Kingdom. Braised beef ramen, smelled awesome
Photo of Wagamama - London, United Kingdom. Loved the thickness and flavor of these noodles!

9dK9T8-Bz6oEXvt2zWDmmw.text: I've had a bad experience at Wagamama previously in Manchester but this one was much better. We popped in at around 8:30pm, it was quite busy but we were seated straight away. We had the squid to start. The seasoning and the dipping sauce didn't add that much flavour so it was still quite dull. For my main I had the vegetarian noodles with mushrooms, eggs and veggies. They were quite nice, the portion was very generous and I was very satisfied.For desert we had the new banana pudding with salted caramel ice cream which was lovely. The service was very quick, literally straight off the wok to the table.

photos.caption: Photo of Wagamama - London, United Kingdom. Yummy vegetarian noodles..

-n47lFu3wTkvJwIw7_JhvA.text: I doubt I can add much that's new to the many, many Wagamama reviews already on here, so I'll just echo the basics: it's a large, spacious, minimally decorated room, service is friendly enough, and the food is delicious and reasonably priced by London standards.This location seems to get a lot of business lunch-hour traffic, but by 1:30 pm on a Tuesday, we could walk in and be seated right away. The large outside tables are family-style, so you might very well have to scoot up next to strangers and pass the soy sauce.I had the pork ramen bowl, which was a generous portion and had meltingly tender pork bits, although the best part of the dish was actually the crisp, fresh bamboo shoots - go figure. My boyfriend had the ginger chicken udon and thought it was good as well.Maybe it was being out in the patio area, but service seemed spotty and somewhat chaotic - we were served by a variety of different staff and were never really sure who our server was if we needed something. Getting the check was pretty slow, which was a bit surprising, since it sounds like they're known for fast turnover. Overall, I was glad to have tried the much-hyped Wagamama experience and thought they delivered fresh and tasty food for a decent price.

aV7YzaWgoVY05HFJZVqc9g.text: Overall I really liked this restaurant. The noise level was still pleasant even though it was full inside. I was seated right away and the service was good. I ordered the 24 which is the chili ramen...beef added ... and I was impressed with the portion size, especially for the steak. I'd definitely come back!!

w3RCTfIlAvwaTNwjJtipww.text: I came here for a group dinner with a bunch of tourists and even despite that, the service wasn't so bad. It was so long ago I don't remember much, other than not being impressed. The food left a bad taste in my mouth, and although the decor and service were good, it couldn't make up for the taste.I had edamame and some noodle vegetable dish that were not too great. Skip the Japanese and go out for Indian food if you need something along those lines of spice.

iB9DW_ZL2REeHanHQ_zZbg.text: Awesome!!  I would definitely return.  Staff was very friendly and offered good advice on what to order.  I had the a curry dish and it was excellent and so were the freshly made fruit drinks.

T9woYu_JFbdYoaJuui3kKQ.text: I think it was just ok since we weren't expecting much to begin with since we knew it wasn't Japanese and more of an "asian fusion" place. We got the veggie katsu curry... which was ok, and the ebi gyoza, which was ok too. If you go here, just don't expect much. Oh, and the location on Yelp map is wrong. It's in the fancy building on the second floor.

photos.caption: Photo of Wagamama - London, United Kingdom. Ebi Gyoza
Photo of Wagamama - London, United Kingdom. Yasai Katsu Curry

NV_gaD_wgoRSLfvdfYPjHA.text: Large open area with over 200 seats along large tables. Large industrial kitchen. Big menu with ramen, donburi and various rice / noodle dishes.  I had the Yasai ramen, not bad but broth was simple and bland. The mudhrooms overpowered the flavor. Not bad but next time I'll definitely get a pork broth based soup. Great for large groups.

xsiqZ0WwuABrWGBSy0rgyg.text: Very goof selection of homestyle Japanese comfort food.  I had the chicken cats curry, my wife had the seafood ramen dish.  Both were delicious.

eIggDha4jA56sVyhR7U4vA.text: I'm a love of Wagamama's, having had it around the world. My favorite location in London is Mansion House, but was staying nearby this location and thought it would be a good one to try. Also introduced three new people to Wagamama, so I was psyched.Our service was great. We sat outside on a lovely day and it was quiet during an early Monday dinner time. Drinks came quickly, as did the food as always. I had the udon noodles, a change from my normal ramen (largely because they have gotten rid of the seafood ramen, which was always my favorite). It was tasty, with slight spice but overall good flavor. You can't go wrong with udon. My wife and her aunt had chicken raisukaree - chicken with Japanese curry. It was really very good, but both of them felt a little iffy afterwards. Neither had had Japanese curry before, so likely that's the situation. Wife's uncle had ramen, and enjoyed it. So, all food was good but none was amazing. Solid outing, but I still find the food at other locations better for whatever reason. Will always return to Wagamama, but I still prefer Mansion House.

zXjlMt4phpIWwypeUXTxGQ.text: Definitely for tastebuds that arent used to eating asian food, let alone anything japanese-ish. Should have trusted the reviews talking about bland flavors. Had to add soy sauce or chili flakes to both curry udon noodles and the 'chili' ramen with chicken.The good: the prawn gyoza were actually quite good and would def order that.-the japanese nest beer was very goodThe bad:-the chili ramen was not spicy not hot, but is called chili as they sprinkles a few pieces of chili on top. The broth and ingredients were basically vietnamese pho, without the robust flavor of pho not the right noodles for it. Epic failure-the stained egg is actually a confuses attempt at japanese soft boiled egg used in ramen, since they also tried to infuse soy sauce flavor like chinese tea eggs. The execution and result? Well , confused. Half the 'stain' was ripped off since they prepared incorrectly and it wasnt runny at all, and no flavor-curry udon fried noodles. Udon well cooked, which was great. Everything else however tasted like what i might make at home by throwing leftovers on top of fried noodles Finally, food is always based relative to price. This was priced like a japanese one star michelin restaurant but was quality of a cafeteria...

ThLfaY8RAbZKj3zr4HEsdA.text: I'm not huge fan of Wagamama. I must be very hungry and desperate to eat there. Curry was aweful, if you know what Japanese curry is supposed to be, this was huge dissapointment  (However, I did read somewhere that Wagamama is NOT authentic Japanese, but rather, fusion  type, therefore maybe I shouldn't complain too much) Price is nice, and location was good with outdoor seating.

ZkHN9qWRoC25SJ7ojlL0Fg.text: Sorry I had to say this but, I really don't see the appeal of this franchise.  I've had loads of Brits recommend that I try out Wagamama, and when I did, meh.  You tried England, you really did.On my latest trip to my castle in Westminister, the group decided to have lunch at Wagamama.  Basically an asian fusion restaurant.  The inside was very modern and family friendly, so far so good.  For starters we had chicken wings, which were tasty.  For the main, I ordered the chili chicken ramen. And no.  There wasn't a hint of chili in my ramen, and the broth had no flavor. I'm not 100%, but I think I was angry that I was served that... The other dishes on the table just looked okay, not too much to say.Wished I could have experienced what most people have experienced, they seem to really love Wagamama.  Or maybe I'm just too used to that California lovin'.

scRJ-IHB6L_F-gsWJLFRSg.text: Food was good and well priced. However of the six people eating, three got food before anyone else and drinks hadn't even arrived at that point. Then about 5 minutes later drinks arrived and then after a while three more dishes arrived so everyone was staggered with eating and drinking. Otherwise very good staff were friendly. Just would have been nice to have all the food arrive at the same point rather than spaced out over 10+ minutes and drinks arrive somewhere in between.

-g20YWdKTwaGEYvX9ZT8aQ.text: Headed to London, we wanted a few places to eat that would be easily accessible, good food, at a reasonable price. Super cool vibe, we actually ate at two different locations. Prices are not cheap but they are fair. Food is awesome.I had the chicken Itame, delicious. It was like green curry, pho, and ramen in one dish. Super hefty portion, and fantastic flavor. My wife and I actually joked that they need one of these in the States, and we wondered if they franchised, because we know it would be a hit.If you are in the London area, definitely hit one of these up as they are sprinkles throughout the city.

gocJN6TxMNHErYTnauZqjA.text: The food is sooo amazing. Great location and excellent service. I will definitely tell my friends to eat at Wagamama. Love it.

photos.caption: Photo of Wagamama - London, United Kingdom

ywzFFUGwc7p12NuH3-IvPQ.text: Great place for ramen! After a long day of touring around London, Wagamama hit the spot! The line got a little long, but people were seated quickly. The food was delicious and so fresh.

iVWEHTgvn8A77aYO3renvA.text: Before coming to London on our honeymoon, I had jotted down all the restaurants I wanted to try, Wagamama was on the top of the list.I didn't know that there would be so many Wagamamas throughout the city, but on our second day of touring about London we found one and I was so excited to try it out!. We ordered ebi(shrimp) katsu for starters and the shirodashi ramen (pork belly ramen with in chicken broth), I am so glad we shared the ramen because the sizes are really generous! I really liked the ebi katsu, really flavorful sauces and shrimp was fried perfectly. The pork belly was really tender, the fatty parts basically melted in your mouth! Good flavors to the broth, but I was a little disappointed in the egg, usually ramen eggs are marinated in a combination of mirin and soy sauce, other than that the food was really delicious. Service here is friendly, food comes out in a timely manner and there are options for everyone!

uSq4rkBk8XB5zdMBYNzlzg.text: The worst ramen I've ever had in my life. Now that that's out of the way, this Wagamama is located within the lovely, modern Cardinal Place. We arrived around 8 p.m. and requested to sit outside to enjoy the unusually warm London weather. Patio closes at 9 and they advised us they would move us inside at that time. The BBQ pork buns were probably my favorite of the meal. The meat was spicy and the Japanese mayo was a nice touch. The Chicken Katsu Curry was delicious and a very generous portion. The Chili Ramen was terrrribleeee. I got the top sirloin and it was inedible- tough, chewy, and no flavor. The copious amount of raw onion on top made the broth taste disgusting. Service was attentive and friendly. I'd go back and skip the ramen.

photos.caption: Photo of Wagamama - London, United Kingdom. Chicken Katsu Curry
Photo of Wagamama - London, United Kingdom. Korean BBQ Beef steamed buns

SMP0oloNmo3mOhEdXtbbjw.text: This is a Asian food chain worth going to at least once. The ramen was overpriced but the juice was good. I ordered the Wagamama ramen and the clean green juice. The ramen had a nice Smokey flavour but slightly too salty. The green juice however was very refreshing on a hot summer day. The staff were very pleasant and seated us quickly and food came fairly quickly. When we paid, the server did not return with our change. We may have given them a bigger tip then deserved because we left without receiving it. As the servers were all too busy clearing tables. We also went during lunch time so be prepared for large crowds!

photos.caption: Photo of Wagamama - London, United Kingdom

LLpxr0XDQgezKXw0ER1X7A.text: I've been reading that Wagamama is good for ramen but I didn't end up ordering that. It was a hot day so I really didn't feel like eating something with hot broth. So I opted for the ginger chicken udon. They use pickled ginger, which I was a bit iffy about at first since I'm not usually a fan. But this was actually really good. The flavor paired well with the saltiness of the noodles. The chicken tasted a bit leftover-y but I still ate everything since I was starving. We have one Wagamama location in NYC so I'll probably go and try the ramen there (though I'm sure it won't be as good). Tip - Wagamama is good for a quick sit down lunch.   The food comes out pretty quickly, so you'll be in and out in about 45 minutes or so.

photos.caption: Photo of Wagamama - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Wagamama - London, United Kingdom. Ginger chicken udon

caVsqhUo2QYO0dxyH_vsyw.text: What used to be good, fun, somewhat delicious is now a raging disappointment. I went to one of the first locations back in '97. It's a huge enterprise now and is essentially the English equivalent of Panda Express. I went today and was literally chased away by scads of bees that kept harassing me on the terrace. Staff couldn't be bothered to reseat me inside so I just ate my appetizer and wandered around for 10 minutes to finally pay someone. And when I did, she seemed annoyed. Whatever.

hb6OEdctwqPiKYc72_rGuw.text: This place hasn't changed in so long, it's lovely! It still stings that they never opened the DC location!

wUX58PrgoUkSTQAnU51vYQ.text: The service is hand down the best service I've ever received at any restaurant ever. First time at Wagamama at Cardinal Place in London & I'd definitely love to come back! Food is priced well moderately, taste is good, and the service is unbelievably amazing. They were so attentive & generous.  Definitely made my night

jjNb3Pl5TSPXvCDUsmReEw.text: Visited for lunch and we were seated within 10 minutes on a busy afternoon. We ordered the shiitake mushroom donburi, which was flavoursome but slightly dry. The veg ramen was excellent and the chicken raisukaree was the best dish we had. Perfectly flavoured and good amount of veggies I would go back for this dish. The service was fantastic and very friendly. Love this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Wagamama - London, United Kingdom. Veg ramen
Photo of Wagamama - London, United Kingdom. Chicken raisukaree
Photo of Wagamama - London, United Kingdom. Shitake donburi

m_BMlZfZT1QxuFhiqo5dwQ.text: Came here on a chilly London day to have a slice of their delicious white chocolate ginger cheesecake.  I highly recommend giving it a try!! *Bonus: they serve alcohol!

photos.caption: Photo of Wagamama - London, United Kingdom. Dessert menu

iPPucvCKGn_bFH7zqrzJlw.text: Before my trip to London, my friend strongly recommended Wagamama, particularly the one in Westminster- saying it's one of the best ramen he has ever had (anywhere).  There was a Wagamama right across my hotel in SoHo but I had to do my friend justice by going to the location he raved about.  The (lack of) queue: We came in around 3:30p and there were no lines.  The restaurant had a lot of seatings but luckily it was a fairly quiet afternoon.  The food: We ordered Asahi beer (yum, classic), fried squid, Wagamama ramen, and Ginger Chicken udon, which were all delicious! The ramen's broth was not as creamy as what I'm used to back home but I love the fact that you can drink the entire bowl and it was not salty.  I would describe the bowl as the healthiest ramen bowl I've eaten (lol).  My friend described the broth as slightly bland.  (To each their own I guess lol).  Although it was a good ramen bowl, I don't think I would order it again - I rather try something else on their extensive menu. BUT I would definitely recommend the fried squid and ginger chicken udon!  The texture of the udon was to die for - I'm huge on texture of noodles and these were on point. I'm always catious of ordering chicken dishes because in most cases, the chicken is too dry.  Unforunately, the chicken that came in the ramen bowl was dry but the chicken in the udon dish was absolutely delicious.  Surprisingly, I liked all the bean sprouts that came with this dish.  If I were to order the udon dish again, I'd ask to put the ginger on the side.  Sometimes it was too much for me.  Wagamama needs to be on your list of to-do's if you're visiting London.

photos.caption: Photo of Wagamama - London, United Kingdom. Ginger chicken udon - so good!
Photo of Wagamama - London, United Kingdom. Fried squid

-0-Iv0qwvEuESGiqWpoo9Q.text: I credit wagamama for embarking me on my ramen journey years ago. It's the first place I can remember trying the Japanese noodles outside of the microwaveable college staple variety, the first time I found out such a legitimized version even existed, and I had a glorious "well, well, well... and what is this?" moment that's stuck with me over time as a result. After a decade hiatus, and many American ramen adventures in the interim, I was excited to return to London and re-visit where it all began.As it turns out, my ramen palate has evolved since my humble beginnings slurping noodles at a British-based, pan-Asian restaurant chain. I ordered the Shirodashi Ramen (pork belly in bulgogi sauce, chicken broth with dashi and miso, pea shoots, menma, spring onions, wakame, tea-stained egg) and the broth was a bit thin and needed more flavor, while the noodles were somewhat clumpy. But I gotta tell you, ramen is ramen, and none of these nitpicks stopped me from scarfing down the whole bowl. That, and a bottle of Hitachino White Ale (a pricier Japanese import beer in the US) was a steal.This specific wagamama is on the second floor of an indoor/outdoor shopping centre, with its typical communal seating set-up. Our initial waitress was a bit of an alarmist when she found out there was a food allergy at the table, saying that we might not be able to order anything. Thankfully, that was not the case and the accommodating manager took over our table and guided us through appropriate options.Fittingly, there was a group of guests in their late-teens / early-twenties not far from our seats, a group that probably didn't look all too different from mine years ago when I first entered a wagamama. Perhaps I'm giving too much credit to this chain, because my nostalgia for this place sadly slipped away as I realized how inferior its ramen was to most other ramens I've had in between. Or perhaps other ramen joints have just gotten that much better. Or perhaps I've just gotten older and more judge-y and should just shut up and enjoy quick-service ramen for what it is. Probably that last one. Regardless, to the aforementioned random group of British uni kids, I pass the ramen torch to you, young millennials.

vbZIJA-1lJKwhf57zWkkQA.text: Delicious Asian food with a ton of variety.  Superb care given to food allergies.  Lovely personable wait and management staff.  We enjoyed eating there several times.  High energy and fun.

photos.caption: Photo of Wagamama - London, United Kingdom. Ramen with pork belly

P5THo-k3ogZdvuMcSPGO0w.text: Staff is friendly but food delivery timing was poorly done, food was lukewarm and virtually tasteless

ork8BglH1MUbKecgiJ1ufA.text: Really wanted to see what ramen was like in London, so opted for this place, as it was close to our hotel and well rated, though left quite disappointed. I ordered the chicken ramen and my boyfriend ordered the chilli chicken ramen. Both were mediocre as they were pretty watery and had grilled chicken/pork.. odd. Though the most disappointing part was the service. They didn't let us sit out on the patio even though they were still operating for at least an hour, and it was a beautiful night. Also our waiter was pretty dissatisfactory and rude. When I asked if they were able to give me lean pork instead of the usual fatty one, he said 'No we don't do that.. you get what we make.' There we're other little remarks that we're unpleasant. Overall, this is not the place to go for a nice ramen dinner, it is a cafeteria style place with a very loud atmosphere that gave limited attention to the actual guests.

GyfJ8WKjQ0Iwn2eJFIy6KQ.text: Japanese fusion. Very busy. Food is good and we are so grateful for the attention they gave us for our allergies and likes. Great manager and chef took time to talk to us and they were so busy love them for that.

4iNVFNHadzG89vosJvFQ0A.text: Everyone raved about the seafood ramen and I was not impressed. Very bland, not much flavor, and lacking substance. Yakiudon was also meh. The flavors didn't blend well at all. The noodles lacked flavor, too much of the other things, the noodles needed to be fried longer to get the crunchy taste. Chili squid was ok. Nothing to rave about. The chasu bun was amazing. The bun itself was moist, warm, and melts in your mouth. The pork was done right and really flavorful. I was not a fan of the Korean BBQ one. Just the flavors were meh, overall, meh. Wouldn't recommend. Two stars for chasu bun and free wifi :)

photos.caption: Photo of Wagamama - London, United Kingdom. Fried squid chili
Photo of Wagamama - London, United Kingdom. Yakiudon -not good
Photo of Wagamama - London, United Kingdom. Pork bun -chasu bun

cPLqPnUPpn8SXw_0QjdYGg.text: Very spacious place for London standards. Friendly staff & pretty good food. The Teriyaki soba and prawn Pad Thai salad were both good, although I wish there was more protein. All in all, good experience for a quick asian fusion at a relatively decent price.

wjqtIiIijhUsuOtZhstdvQ.text: I am so impressed with this place. The food was good, didn't blow me out of the water, but it was above average. But the thing that really got me about this place is the way they handled my wife's peanut allergy. We told the waitress when we entered and she immediately got the manager who showed us the nutritional info for everything on the menu and then personally delivered all of her food. Just wow. They went above and beyond. I recommend this place for anyone with an allergy or dietary restriction.

photos.caption: Photo of Wagamama - London, United Kingdom
